meanings.definition: To float on or in a body of water.
meanings.sent1: The leaf will flote on the pond.
meanings.sent2: The boat will flote gently on the calm lake.
meanings.sent3: The rubber duck liked to flote around in the bathtub.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts seemed to flote aimlessly in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The colorful balloons flote gracefully in the sky.

meanings.definition: A group of boats or ships.
meanings.sent1: The flote of ships sailed together in the harbor.
meanings.sent2: We watched the flote of boats pass by on the river.
meanings.sent3: The flote of toy boats in the pool looked adorable.
meanings.sent4: The flote of ships resembled a moving city on the water.
meanings.sent5: The flote of boats created a beautiful scene on the lake.

meanings.definition: A musical note that is sustained or held.
meanings.sent1: The singer held the high flote beautifully.
meanings.sent2: The flote in the song added a touch of elegance.
meanings.sent3: The musician played the flote with great skill.
meanings.sent4: The flote lingered in the air, captivating the audience.
meanings.sent5: The flote at the end of the piece left a lasting impression.
